timeline.bodyHTML:
Any particular reason for duplicating the value of the constant? Would be less redundancy to have the new DEFAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER introduced first with value and then the deprecated name backreferencing it:

    @Deprecated
    public static final String DEAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER = DEFAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER;
timeline.author: joheriks
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -128,10 +128,21 @@
     /**
      * Default folder for copying front-end resources present in the classpath
      * jars.
+     * @deprecated This is deprecated due to a typo.
+     *             Use DEFAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER instead.
+     * @see #DEFAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER
      */
+    @Deprecated
     public static final String DEAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER = TARGET
             + "flow-frontend";

replies.bodyText: Good point. I can change it (maybe later today when I'm back at my computer, or tomorrow)
replies.author: Haprog

timeline.message:
Fix typo in variable DEAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER

Replace DEAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER with DEFAULT_FLOW_RESOURCES_FOLDER, but keep the old variable as deprecated.

timeline.body: ![INFO](https://sonarsource.github.io/sonar-github/severity-info.png 'Severity: INFO') Do not forget to remove this deprecated code someday. [![rule](https://sonarsource.github.io/sonar-github/rule.png)](https://sonar.projects.vaadin.com/coding_rules#rule_key=squid%3AS1133)
